intro: Randia mixe, commonly known as Mexican randia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pink, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Randia mixe is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
